author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Upon the market, fair and wide,
Forsooth the FTSE riseth high,
Builders and HSBC claim their prize,
Whilst BP falleth, no disguise.

With bated breath, await we here,
As oil doth rise, both far and near,
Full meet for gathering central banks,
This week quoth wisdom from their ranks.

In yon realm, where dollar reigns,
A fall, me thinks, one scarce gains,
Before the meeting with the Fed,
Weaker data shan't through us tread.

feedItems.title: FTSE 100 Rises as HSBC, Builders Gain; BP Falls
feedItems.description: London’s FTSE 100 rose 0.2% as gains for HSBC and construction stocks outpaced losses for oil and mining stocks.

feedItems.title: Oil Inches Up Ahead of Fed, ECB Meetings This Week
feedItems.description: Oil prices edged higher in Europe as investors await a busy week of central bank meetings and economic data.

feedItems.title: Dollar Unlikely to Fall Much Ahead of Fed Meeting
feedItems.description: Weaker-than-expected U.S. JOLTS job opening data could cause the DXY dollar index to weaken by around 0.5% but investors are unlikely to sell it much more ahead of the Fed rate decision, ING said.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In Hong Kong's verdant land so fair,
Returneth growth with blossoms rare,
Reopened borders, China's grace,
Four weary quarters now apace.

To German lands, gaze I anon,
In sideways flight of April's bond,
Uneventful dances the linker,
As real yields rest 'round the brink here.

And yonder, BP's gilded chest,
Profits slow, yet better than best,
Five billion shimmer, as fortunes weave,
Share buybacks, an ample reprieve.

feedItems.title: Hong Kong Returns to Growth Amid Reopening
feedItems.description: Hong Kong’s economy in the first quarter grew 2.7%, as a reopening of borders and China’s economic rebound helped break a streak of four quarterly contractions.

feedItems.title: Germany's April 2033 Linker In Sideways Move Between Auctions
feedItems.description: Germany’s 0.10% April 2033 inflation-linked Bund has been trading mostly sideways since its last auction a month ago, with its real yield remaining at around 0%, UniCredit Research said.

feedItems.title: BP Profit Slows, but Beats Views
feedItems.description: BP reported a first quarter underlying replacement cost profit of almost $5 billion, and said it planned to launch an additional $1.8 billion share buyback.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of rates and interest, Austral's plight,
To raise again, with doubt and fright,
Anon they paused, now in dismay,
Their realm's economy to weigh.

On Royal DSM, a burden falls,
Decline in sales due to inflation's mauls,
And in their woes, be it known,
That profit dwindles, strength be flown.

And now, behold! A surge of gain,
HSBC finds profit once again,
In interest's yield and ledger's page,
A dividend declared, first time since past age.

feedItems.title: Australia, Spooked by Inflation, Resumes Raising Interest Rates
feedItems.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia surprised financial markets by raising interest rates a month after pausing to assess the impact of earlier tightening on its economy.

feedItems.title: Royal DSM Sales, Earnings Hit by High Inflation
feedItems.description: Royal DSM reported a fall in underlying earnings and sales for the first quarter as high inflation weighed.

feedItems.title: HSBC Profit Surges in First Quarter on Interest Income, Accounting Gains
feedItems.description: The bank announced its first quarterly dividend since 2019.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In waves of gold, the Bank doth stand
Its course be steady, upon this land
Upraised but by a newfound might
The raging tempest still doth fight

At giants' call, with tightened rein
The golden serpent doth attain
HSBC's banners rise, by Thor's decree
Enrich'd by ships of policy

Upon the far-off western shore
Where playwrights weave their endless lore
The ink hath dried, the quills do pause
As thunder roars o'er script-forged laws

feedItems.title: Reserve Bank of Australia Resumes Interest-Rate Increases
feedItems.description: The central bank surprised financial markets and raised its official cash rate by 25 basis points to 3.85%, resuming an aggressive campaign of increases.

feedItems.title: HSBC's Profit Surges, Lifted by Tight Monetary Policy Globally
feedItems.description: The Asia-focused bank’s first-quarter net profit surged more than three times compared with a year earlier, as the lender continues to benefit from tighter monetary policy globally.

feedItems.title: Hollywood Writers to Strike After Talks Break Down
feedItems.description: Late-night and variety shows are expected to be the first to feel the effects of a strike.
